front.note: Confidential: not for distribution. Submitted to IOP Publishing for peer review

docTitle.titlePart:
Exclusive rare B s → (K, η, η′ )ℓ ℓ− decays in the
light-front quark model

byline.affiliation:
Department of Physics, Teachers College, Kyungpook National
University,

front.div:
Abstract. Using the light-front quark model, we calculate the transition form
factors, decay rates, and longitudinal lepton polarization asymmetries for the exclusive
rare B s → (K, η () )( +  − , ν  ¯
ν  ( = e, µ, τ ) decays within the standard model,
taking into account the η − η  mixing angle. For the mixing angle θ = −20
(−10 @BULLET ) in the octet-singlet basis, we obtain BR(B s → η

ν  ¯
ν  ) = 1.1 (1.7) × 10 −6 ,
BR(B s → ηµ + µ − ) = 1.5 (2.4) × 10 −7 , BR(B s → ητ + τ − ) = 3.8 (5.8) × 10 −8 ,
BR(B s → η  
ν  ¯
ν  ) = 1.8 (1.3) × 10 −6 , BR(B s → η  µ + µ − ) = 2.4 (1.8) × 10 −7 ,
and BR(B s → η  τ + τ − ) = 3.4 (2.6) × 10 −8 , respectively. The branching ratios for
the B s → K(ν  ¯
ν  , , +  − ) decays are at least an order of magnitude smaller than those
for the B s → η () (ν  ¯
ν  , , +  − ) decays. The averaged values of the lepton polarization
asymmetries for B s → (K, η () ) +  − are obtained as P K
L  µ = P η
L  µ = P η 
L  µ =
−0.98, P K
L  τ = −0.24, P η
L  τ = −0.20 and P η 
L  τ = −0.14, respectively.
